recipes.name: Finnish Salmon Soup (Lohikeitto)
instructions: Cut the leeks into thin strips and wash them well. Peel and slice the carrots and cut the potatoes into cubes. Cut the fresh salmon into large cubes. Chop the dill finely.
In a large saucepan, sauté the leeks and sliced carrots in butter or olive oil.
Once the leeks have reduced in volume by half, add the potatoes and fish stock. Season with salt and black pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes at medium heat until the potatoes are cooked.
10 minutes before serving, add the salmon chunks and cream. Cook over medium heat for 3-5 minutes until the salmon is cooked. The cream should not boil. Close the lid and wait another 5 minutes.
To finish, add the fresh dill. Serve in a bowl and decorate with more dill, black pepper, and a drizzle of lemon juice if you like.

recipes.name: Żebroczka (potato traybake)
instructions: Peel the potatoes and grate or blend them. Cook the rice. Heat up the milk.
Cut the onions and garlic and fry it on medium heat until golden brown.
Put everything in a casserole dish, add the spices, stir and put in the oven at 180 degrees for about 50 minutes or until brown and crispy on top.
Let cool down, cut into pieces and serve (with sour cream).
Optional: Add veggies of your choice (e.g. mushrooms, spinach etc.).

recipes.name: Placki Ziemniaczane (potato pancakes)
instructions: Peel and grate the potatoes. Blend or finely cut the onions and garlic and add them to the potatoes.
Add flour until it binds together and gets thicker. Add more or less depending on your liking.
Season with plenty of pepper and some salt
Preheat a pan properly on medium high heat with some oil.
Spread the batter on the pan and fry the pancake on both sides until golden-brown.
Optional: Serve with créme fraiche or fried bacon cubes.

recipes.name: Pierogi Ruskie (Dumplings with potatoes and quark)

sections.name: Dough:
instructions: Add flour, water, salt and oil into a bowl and knead the dough until it is elastic and smooth.
Let it rest for at least 10 minutes
Roll the dough out flat, sprinkle a bit with flour so it doesn't stick and cut out circles with a glass

sections.name: Filling:
instructions: Boil the potatoes and mash them. Fry the onion until golden brown. Add to the potatoes and mix it well.
Add the twaróg (or quark) and mix it well. Add salt and pepper to taste.

sections.name: General:
instructions: Scoop roughly a teaspoon of the filling into the cut out dough circles, fold the dough over and press the edges together to seal.
Boil the dumplings in salted water until they float to the surface. Serve with créme fraiche or fried onions if desired.
Optional: fry the dumplings in a pan after boiling to make them crispy.

sections.name: Dough:
instructions: Add flour, water, salt and oil into a bowl and knead the dough until it is elastic and smooth.
Let it rest for at least 10 minutes
Roll the dough out flat, sprinkle a bit with flour so it doesn't stick and cut out circles with a glass

sections.name: Filling:
instructions: Fry the mushrooms in a dry pan until all moisture evaporates. Add oil and onions and fry the onion until golden brown.
Cut the sauerkraut in smaller pieces and add to the pan. Briefly fry until sauerkraut softens. Add salt and pepper to taste.

sections.name: General:
instructions: Scoop roughly a teaspoon of the filling into the cut out dough circles, fold the dough over and press the edges together to seal.
Boil the dumplings in salted water until they float to the surface. Serve with créme fraiche or fried onions if desired.
Optional: fry the dumplings in a pan after boiling to make them crispy.

Let it rest for at least 10 minutes
Roll the dough out flat, sprinkle a bit with flour so it doesn't stick and cut out circles with a glass

sections.name: Filling:
instructions: Fry the spinach till it shrinks and softens. Crumble the boullion cube and add it to the spinach. Add small feta cubes and mix well.

sections.name: General:

Boil the dumplings in salted water until they float to the surface. Serve with créme fraiche or fried onions if desired.
Optional: fry the dumplings in a pan after boiling to make them crispy.

Roll the dough out flat, sprinkle a bit with flour so it doesn't stick and cut out circles with a glass

sections.name: Filling:
instructions: Grate the apples and fry them until soft. Add the cinnamon.

Optional: fry the dumplings in a pan after boiling to make them crispy.

sections.name: Filling:
instructions: Cook the beetroot and grate it. Add the ricotta and then add salt and pepper to taste.

sections.name: General:
instructions: Scoop roughly a teaspoon of the filling into the cut out dough circles, fold the dough over and press the edges together to seal.
Boil the dumplings in salted water until they float to the surface. Serve with créme fraiche or fried onions if desired.
Optional: fry the dumplings in a pan after boiling to make them crispy.

recipes.name: Fasolka po Bretońsku (bean stew) - vegetarian
instructions: Soak the beans overnight in plenty of water. Strain the beans, put them in a pot, add the water and boil on low heat.
Add the bay leaf, salt, piment and boil until the beans are soft.

Wrap the tofu in a kitchen towel and put a weight on top to squeeze out the water. Cut in cubes and add to a bowl. Add the marmite, soy sauce, some oil, ketjap manis, and smoked paprika. Mix well and spread out on a baking tray. Bake the tofu at 180 degrees for 30 minutes or until crispy.
Cut the bell peppers in pieces and put on a tray. Bake at 180 degrees for 30 minutes or until soft and slightly charred.
Fry the mushrooms on a dry pan until they are nice and brown and all the water evaporates. Add a bit of oil and then the onions and garlic and fry until soft and golden brown.

Put the peppers, tofu, mushrooms, onions etc. to the boiling beans. Add the can of tomatoes and some corn starch if necessary to achieve a nicer thicker consistency. Season with some salt pepper, oregano, two heapful teaspoons of paprika and smoked paprika. Serve with bread and some parsly on top.

recipes.name: Asian Style Round Potato Noodles with Chicken and Pakchoy
instructions: Peel and boil the potatoes until soft. Mash them and let cool down. Then add the starch and mix properly until you get a smooth dough.

Roll little dough balls and make a little dent with your finger or a chopstick in the middle. Boil a big pot of water and throw in the balls in little batches. They are done when they float to the top. For best results briefly rinse the balls in a bowl of cold water.

Put the balls in a bowl, add the chilli flakes, sesame and crushed garlic on top. Heat up the oil until it starts smoking. Pour the hot oil on top of the potato balls and seasoning. Finally, add the soy sauce and mix well.
Cut the chicken in small pieces and fry in your favourite way.
Cut the pakchoy in smaller pieces and briefly blanch in boiling water.
Serve the potato noodles/balls, chicken and pakchoy on a board. Decorate with some more spring onions if you like.

recipes.name: Easy Egg Fried Noodles
instructions: Boil the noodles according to the instructions. Strain them, rinse in cold water and let them dry a bit.
Dice the onion, cut the carrots in cubes, mince the garlic, and cut the spring onion.
Heat up the oil in a pan on high heat and add the onion and carrots for two minutes. Then add the garlic and spring onion. Fry for 5 more minutes.
Add the strained noodles to the pan and stir from time to time for 2 minutes. Add an egg straight into the pan and mix well to scramble the egg.
Take the pan off the heat and add the sesame oil, sesame seeds, soy sauce and sambal oelek.
Tip: This is a small meal. Add more vegetables, meat or tofu to your liking. You can also replace the sambal with your favorite chilli paste/powder.

recipes.name: Shrimp Saganaki
instructions: Dice the onion, mince the garlic and cut the chilli. Add to a hot pan with oil. Fry for a few minutes and then add the tomato sauce and tomato puree.
Add the (frozen) shrimp and cook them in the tomato sauce until they are done.
Add the oregano, thyme, and salt and pepper to taste. Squeeze out the lemon juice and crumble the feta cheese into the pan. Stir well and serve.
Tip: This is a small meal. You can eat it with bread, rice or pasta (e.g., orzo)

recipes.name: Easy One Pot Pasta
instructions: Lay down the spaghetti flat into a big pot/pan. Next cut the courgette and aubergine in small 2cm cubes, and cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Add them to the pot.
Cut the garlic, onion and red chilli in slices and spread them evenly in the pot. Put the basil leaves in the pot as well.

Add a drizzle of olive oil and then top up with ca. 600ml of water. Put the pot on a stove and bring to a boil. Once the pasta softens a bit stir it with the other ingredients. Boil until the pasta and vegetables are soft and the liquid reduces to a nice sauce. Add water if necessary.
Grate the cheese and add it to the pan. Season with salt and pepper.
